interpretation.0-40: Critical gaps - High risk of poor equity outcomes
interpretation.41-60: Moderate gaps - Some infrastructure present, significant improvement needed
interpretation.61-80: Minor gaps - Strong baseline with targeted improvement areas

PROCESS.pillar_description: Evaluates whether care pathways, workflows, and operational procedures facilitate or impede equitable access and outcomes.

questions.question: Does your organization have documented, standardized care pathways for maternal health services?
questions.rationale: Documented pathways ensure consistency and enable equity analysis across patient populations.

questions.question: Are care pathways reviewed and updated to address identified disparities?
questions.rationale: Responsive pathway updates ensure workflows adapt to identified equity gaps.

questions.question: What percentage of care pathways include specific accommodations for language barriers?
questions.rationale: Language accessibility in pathways ensures non-English speakers can navigate care.

questions.question: Does your organization assess and address transportation barriers for patients?
questions.rationale: Transportation is a critical social determinantâ€”pathways must address it.

questions.question: Are appointment scheduling systems designed to accommodate working patients (evening/weekend options)?
questions.rationale: Traditional business hours exclude working mothers disproportionately.

questions.question: What percentage of clinical services offer telehealth options?
questions.rationale: Telehealth access flexibility supports working families and rural populations.

questions.question: Are referral processes streamlined to minimize care gaps and delays?
questions.rationale: Referral delays disproportionately affect vulnerable populations.

questions.question: Does your organization have a formal process for identifying and addressing social determinants of health?
questions.rationale: SDOH screening must be systematized in workflows to address equity.

questions.question: What percentage of care teams include community health workers or patient navigators?
questions.rationale: CHWs bridge cultural and logistical gaps in care access.

questions.question: Are postpartum follow-up appointments built into standard workflows?
questions.rationale: Postpartum period is high-risk; proactive follow-up workflows save lives.

questions.question: Does your organization coordinate care across hospital, clinic, and community settings?
questions.rationale: Care coordination reduces gaps that disproportionately harm vulnerable populations.

questions.question: Are high-risk patients identified and enrolled in enhanced care pathways?
questions.rationale: Risk stratification must trigger differentiated care to improve outcomes.

questions.question: Do care pathways include doula or peer support integration?
questions.rationale: Doula support significantly improves outcomes, especially for communities of color.

questions.question: Are patients able to schedule appointments through multiple modalities (phone, online, app, in-person)?
questions.rationale: Access flexibility accommodates diverse patient needs and preferences.

questions.question: Does your organization have workflows for addressing missed appointments proactively?
questions.rationale: Proactive outreach prevents care gaps from becoming crises.

questions.question: Are interpreter services embedded in standard workflows (not just available upon request)?
questions.rationale: On-request interpreters create delays; embedded services ensure equity.

questions.question: What percentage of clinical protocols include equity considerations (e.g., cultural factors, SDOH)?
questions.rationale: Equity must be integrated into protocols, not addressed separately.

questions.question: Does your organization conduct workflow analyses to identify equity barriers?
questions.rationale: Systematic workflow analysis identifies hidden barriers to equity.

questions.question: Are emergency department processes designed to identify and address maternal health emergencies?
questions.rationale: ED protocols must recognize maternal warning signs across presentations.

questions.question: Does your organization have a process for patients to provide feedback on care access barriers?
questions.rationale: Patient voice reveals barriers invisible to administrators.

PEOPLE.pillar_description: Evaluates whether workforce training, cultural competence, and accountability structures enable equitable service delivery.

questions.question: What percentage of clinical staff have completed health equity training in the past 12 months?
questions.rationale: Training must be universal and current to impact care delivery.

questions.question: Does health equity training go beyond implicit bias to include actionable skills?
questions.rationale: Awareness alone doesn't change practice; skills training drives behavior change.

questions.question: Are equity metrics tied to individual or team performance evaluations?
questions.rationale: Accountability requires consequences; performance metrics drive behavior.

questions.question: What percentage of leadership positions (VP and above) have equity included in their job descriptions?
questions.rationale: Leadership accountability starts with explicit responsibility in role definitions.

questions.question: Does your organization employ community health workers from the communities you serve?
options: CHWs employed but not from community
questions.rationale: Lived experience and cultural connection are critical to equity work.

questions.question: What percentage of patient-facing staff are bilingual or have immediate access to professional interpreters?
questions.rationale: Language capacity must be widespread, not concentrated in specific units.

questions.question: Does your organization have a Chief Equity Officer or equivalent senior leadership position?
questions.rationale: Senior leadership signals priority and enables resource allocation.

questions.question: Does the Chief Equity Officer (or equivalent) have budget authority?
questions.rationale: Responsibility without resources is performative, not operational.

questions.question: Are front-line staff empowered to escalate equity concerns without retaliation?
questions.rationale: Psychological safety enables identification and resolution of equity issues.

questions.question: What percentage of clinical staff can articulate your organization's equity goals?
questions.rationale: Equity goals must be widely known to influence daily decisions.

questions.question: Does your organization provide ongoing cultural humility training (not one-time)?
questions.rationale: Cultural competence requires continuous learning, not single events.

questions.question: Are doulas or birth support specialists employed and integrated into care teams?
questions.rationale: Doula support improves outcomes, especially for communities of color.

questions.question: Does your workforce demographics reflect the patient population you serve?
questions.rationale: Representative workforce builds trust and cultural understanding.

questions.question: Are equity champions or liaisons designated within clinical departments?
questions.rationale: Distributed leadership embeds equity work throughout the organization.

questions.question: What percentage of new hires receive equity training during onboarding?
questions.rationale: Equity orientation must be universal from day one.

questions.question: Does leadership regularly communicate about equity performance and goals?
questions.rationale: Frequent communication signals priority and maintains focus.

questions.question: Are patient advocates or navigators available to help patients understand and access services?
questions.rationale: Navigation support reduces complexity barriers disproportionately affecting vulnerable populations.

questions.question: Does your organization conduct stay interviews or exit interviews to understand equity-related workforce concerns?
questions.rationale: Staff retention and satisfaction correlate with equity culture and effectiveness.

questions.question: Are clinicians trained to recognize and address social determinants of health?
questions.rationale: SDOH awareness must be universal clinical competency.

questions.question: Does your organization have a formal mentorship or sponsorship program for staff from underrepresented backgrounds?
questions.rationale: Leadership pipeline diversity requires intentional development support.

TECHNOLOGY.pillar_description: Evaluates whether data systems, monitoring tools, and technology infrastructure enable measurement, accountability, and improvement.

questions.question: Can your EHR system stratify clinical outcomes by race and ethnicity in real-time?
questions.rationale: Real-time stratification enables immediate intervention on emerging disparities.

questions.question: What percentage of patients have race/ethnicity data accurately recorded in the EHR?
questions.rationale: Missing data prevents disparity identification; completeness is foundational.

questions.question: Does your organization have automated alerts for high-risk maternal health conditions?
questions.rationale: Automated alerts enable timely intervention on preventable complications.

questions.question: Can providers view a patient's complete care history across all settings (hospital, clinic, community)?
questions.rationale: Care coordination requires information continuity across settings.

questions.question: Does your patient portal offer language options beyond English?
questions.rationale: Digital health equity requires multilingual technology access.

questions.question: What percentage of patients are enrolled in the patient portal?
questions.rationale: Portal adoption enables patient engagement and self-management.

questions.question: Does your organization track and report equity metrics to leadership monthly or more frequently?
questions.rationale: Frequent reporting maintains leadership focus and enables rapid response.

questions.question: Can your analytics team generate disparity reports without manual data extraction?
questions.rationale: Automated reporting enables scalability and timeliness of equity analysis.

questions.question: Does your organization use predictive analytics to identify high-risk patients?
questions.rationale: Predictive models enable proactive intervention before crises occur.

questions.question: Are social determinants of health systematically collected in the EHR?
questions.rationale: SDOH data collection must be systematic to enable action.

questions.question: Does your telehealth platform meet accessibility standards (ADA, language, broadband limitations)?
questions.rationale: Telehealth equity requires accessible technology design.

questions.question: Can patients schedule appointments online in their preferred language?
questions.rationale: Language barriers in scheduling systems create access inequities.

questions.question: Does your organization have a data governance process ensuring equity in algorithm design and deployment?
questions.rationale: Algorithmic bias perpetuates disparities; governance prevents harm.

questions.question: What percentage of clinical decision support tools have been tested for equity impact?
questions.rationale: Untested algorithms may embed and amplify existing biases.

questions.question: Can your organization track patient outcomes longitudinally (not just during encounters)?
questions.rationale: Longitudinal tracking reveals disparities that episode-based analysis misses.

questions.question: Does your organization share data with community partners for population health improvement?
questions.rationale: Community partnerships require data sharing for collective impact.

questions.question: Are patients able to access their health records through mobile devices?
questions.rationale: Mobile access accommodates populations without computer access.

questions.question: Does your organization have a process for evaluating and addressing technology access barriers?
questions.rationale: Digital divide assessment must be systematic, not assumed.

questions.question: Can your organization generate equity dashboards for different levels of leadership (board, C-suite, managers)?
questions.rationale: Tailored dashboards enable accountability at every leadership level.

questions.question: Does your IT procurement process include equity impact assessments for new technology?
questions.rationale: Equity must be considered before technology deployment, not after.
